issues.title: QA DICOM Web Viewer i18nLocalesPath Integration
Support imaging with multiple images (CT or MRI)
issues.body: The issue is that the current dicom mechanism only supports 1 image. This is great for xrays. However, it sounds like this will get much more complicated for imaging with multiple images (such as a CT or MRI).

issues.title: Document reference isn't stored in the database when a patient has a very large pid
issues.body:
This bug is minor because it can only really happen from the use of another tool connected to the OpenEMR database (patient demo generator, for example, which has been patched), but basically when a patient `pid` is huge (e.g.: 99999999999), certain `foreign_id` fields in tables that point back to the `patient_data` table can't hold the value. This is the case with the `documents` table.

This would be a good first issue for someone looking to explore the code.

issues.title: Roadmap Project Work (Joyce)
issues.body:
This is a issue to account for the work for organizing and defining the roadmap projects into github projects with detailed issues. Joyce and Matthew are splitting the work in half. This is the half that will be taken care of in this issue:

• Clinical Intelligence Dashboards
• Intelligent Chart Summarization
• Normalized Code Directory Structure
• Separation of Business Logic Code
• Module Framework
• Frontend User Interface Rework
• Telemedicine Support
• Speech Dictation Documentation
• Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS)

```
Joyce and I agreed the following is the best workflow:

1. When visiting http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Roadmaps#OpenEMR_Project_Roadmap, each link should go to the Github Project
2. The Github Project is named after the roadmap project and has fully detailed issues for anyone to work on
3. On the Github project, there is a link to the Forum post which is for brainstorming and updates (make sure to relevant people are subscribed to the thread to get updates)

Notes:
- It would be useful to announce the projects as they are ready for volunteers and specify exactly how the work will be tracked (this will include a sentence about how each issue will define the requirements)
```

issues.title: Low Cost Medical Devices Search for OpenEMR Integration
issues.body:
We wish to provide an affordable and high-quality hardware solution in order to be compliant with an API being developed for OpenEMR. In doing so, less financially-strapped hospitals will become at parity with the "data centric" style of US HIT.

- [x] Investigate the markets
- [x] @MatthewVita to note the eventual documentation style will need to be "documentation" and not "advise".  (see comment https://github.com/openemr/openemr/issues/978#issuecomment-319731395 and the one below it)
- [ ] @TheToolbox to record his unique perspectives on the device testing strategies
- [x] answer Libelium (MySignals) proposal  - Discount until 7/31
- [x] see if Libelium (MySignals) can sell us just the EKG device for testing (no CPU)
- [ ] Look for low cost EKG and Pulse Oximeter/Blood Oxygen devices that are either usb devices or RaspPis that work with cheap Android tablets or Windows netbooks.

For more information on MySignals: http://www.my-signals.com/#what-is-mysignals

Note: This ticket is for tracking Andre and Matthew's work.

issues.title: Determine best practice to avoid "double escaping" in Doctrine
issues.body:
## Context

The current working practice for Doctrine SQL injection prevention is to use the standard OpenEMR escaping functions before feeding data into Doctrine. However, @bradymiller has noted that this approach may not be sustainable.

## Problem

Per http://docs.doctrine-project.org/projects/doctrine-dbal/en/latest/reference/security.html, we need to look out for "double escaping", which can lead to data corruption

## Actionables

1. Determine how to avoid the dreaded "double escapes".
2. Document how to properly escape for Doctrine in the Wiki. If the solution turns out to require the programmer to be aware of leaky abstractions in Doctrine, create a facade utility to avoid this.

issues.title: Modernization of Drugs/Prescriptions/Inventory
issues.body:
## GOAL

There are many areas of our codebase that reference drugs, prescriptions, sales, inventory, pharmacies, etc. All of the logic around these entities should be centralized in services. Currently, the logic is mostly coupled with the view (e.g.: direct database calls from the view, sometimes even copy/pasted several times).

As with all of the work in the backend modernization project, the view and the business logic/database logic should be separated so that (if we wanted to) we could make an OpenEMR REST API. Where possible, Doctrine should be used to provide a more modern object oriented approach, however, we know that `patient_data` and similar dynamic tables are a non-starter with Doctrine.

## TASKS

- [x] @MatthewVita, @kofiav, @juggernautsei: Find out all of the tables that deal with drugs, prescriptions, sales, inventory, pharmacies.
- [ ] @MatthewVita, @kofiav: Study how the code works currently with reference to the following tables:
  - `drugs`
  - `drug_inventory`
  - `drug_sales`
  - `drug_templates`
  - `product_warehouse`
  - `prices`
  - `prescriptions`
  - `pharmacies`
  - `phone_numbers`
  - `addresses`
  - `erx_drug_paid`
  - `erx_narcotics`
  - `erx_rx_log`
  - `patient_data`
- [ ] @juggernautsei: Think about how these should be split up into here: https://github.com/openemr/openemr/tree/master/services (remember that very specific services are fine too. For example, we already have a `PatientService` (recently created and doesn't do too much, however). It would be totally fine to create a `PatientPrescriptionService` that is called into from something like `patientServiceInstance->getAllPrescriptionsForPatient(pid)`). In other words, the `PatientService` could be a _facade_ to all of these other services.
- [ ] @MatthewVita: Start to think about how we can separate up the work in terms of making individual tickets (obviously this current ticket doesn't encapulate everything)

## HANGOUTS

Once Sherwin makes some progress with the "Think about how these should be split up" task, I believe it is a great idea to have a Google Hangout so he can explain his findings. We have to have a strong coding foundation for all of these different entities.

### NOTE FROM MATTHEW

Most of my free time has been focusing on shipping the Version 1 BETA of https://github.com/GoTeamEpsilon/OpenEMR-AWS-Guide - I am definitely going to make time for this project, but I want you all to know that the cloud guide is my #1 priority at the moment. Thank you for understanding.

issues.title: Patient Context Image Enhancement
issues.body:
@Jeffrey-P-McAteer and I were on a Google Hangout the other day and Jeffrey mentioned that it would be neat to show the patient's picture in in the "context box". While this image is viewable in the main patient page via the "ID/Card Photos" toggle, it can be argued that showing a small version of the patient image across the app is a better user experience because the user may be on the other pages (billing, labs, documents, encounter, etc).

In terms of implementation, we can use the `$GLOBALS['patient_photo_category_name'])` and the existing query:

```
select documents.id from documents join categories_to_documents " .
                 "on documents.id = categories_to_documents.document_id " .
                 "join categories on categories.id = categories_to_documents.category_id " .
                 "where categories.name like ? and documents.foreign_id = ?";
```

We also need to make sure this works when we grab the image from Couch.

In terms of design, we can put it next to the existing content (kind of sloppy, in my eyes): 

![simple](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1715206/24334238/1b30f3ae-1235-11e7-9a33-265fa924ef53.PNG)

Or we can redesign the context box to be a "card" (WARNING: I am terrible at sketching):

![webcam-toy-photo5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1715206/24334239/1b320f32-1235-11e7-81fe-67a1a983b519.jpg)

Matthew

issues.title: Adding acl group to user on create/edit user
issues.body:
Hi.
Currently users that don't have the 'Administration ACL' permission can't add/edit user's acl group. 
This means that if a user has permissions to create users but does not have Administration ACL permission he can only create users without any permissions, which is pretty useless.
We think that the ability to add/edit a user's acl group (in the add/edit users screen - not in the acl screen) should not be part of the 'Administration ACL' permission but rather part of the 'Users/Groups/Logs Administration' permission.

issues.title: Procedure Relations
issues.body:
Hello dears

when we try to add a procedure in openemr , it is added under one provider's position.
for example we have one common procedure which presents more than one provider and we want to use that procedure for more than one provider so this way we have to repeat the procedure more than one time in database . [The relation between the provider's & procedure's table is one 2 many ]

We need many 2 many relation.
Dose openemr has default solution for this issue or not? (And if I have to change the codes?)

issues.title: Surfing projects through recent mega-commit for psr2 styling changes of entire codebase
issues.body:
Steps:
First, copy the most recent phpcs.xml script to use further below:
1. `git checkout upstream/master`
2. `cp ci/phpcs.xml ../`
3. `git checkout master`

Second, create a "transition" branch that will be used further below:
1. `git checkout 0d00c1c`
2. `git checkout -b phpcbf-filter-1`
2. `cp ../phpcs.xml ci/phpcs.xml`
3. `php ~/git/PHP_CodeSniffer/bin/phpcbf -n --extensions=php,inc --standard=ci/phpcs.xml .`
4. `rm ci/phpcs.xml`
5. `git commit -a -m "filter 1 for phpcbf"`

Third, now can start to update projects (using weno rx code as example):
1. `git checkout new_erx_2`
2. rebase all the commits into 1 commit
3. `git rebase 0d00c1c`  (basically rebasing it to code base before the megacommit was brought in)
4. `cp ../phpcs.xml ci/phpcs.xml`
5. `php ~/git/PHP_CodeSniffer/bin/phpcbf -n --extensions=php,inc --standard=ci/phpcs.xml .`
6. `rm ci/phpcs.xml`
7. `git commit -a -m "temp phpcbf run"`
8. `git rebase -i HEAD~2` (and combine these 2 commits into 1 commit)
9. `git rebase phpcbf-filter-1`
10. `git checkout upstream/master`
11. `git checkout -b new_erx_3`
12. `git cherry-pick  <sha1 from the top commit that was created in step 9 above>`
DONE :)

issues.title: Add Zend Module Report Hook to the Tabs user interface
issues.body: The Zend Module Reports Hook only is supported in the Frames user interface and not the Tabs user interface. So, need to add support of this also in the Tabs user interface.

issues.title: Potential sql encoding installation bug
issues.body: There have been several reports of not being able go into the globals screen because of encoding issues. I just discussed this with a user on livechat whom had all latin1 tables despite doing the standard setup.php script which should default to using UTF8 encoding. Note that in select.php can select none for encoding and go with the mysql default, however this requires effort; and I am beginning to suspect that OpenEMR is installing with the default mysql server settings no matter what is chosen in setup.php. This of course requires testing, but if this is the case, then is a nasty bug that will require patch and new packages.

issues.title: Incorporate Zend module report hooks
issues.body: This does not work in the tabs user interface (it works fine in the frames user interface).

issues.title: Telehealth and video conferencing
issues.body:
Now that we are getting close to having a fully featured patient portal, it's a good time to think about telehealth and video conferencing. Notably, the new patient portal will actually have a chat feature already, so guessing that adding a video conference option that could also incorporate the calendar shouldn't be that tough. Here are several possible tools:
- http://peerjs.com/ (free/open source and apparently HIPAA compliant)
- https://webrtc.org/ (free/open source and apparently HIPAA compliant)
- https://vsee.com/blog/google-helpouts-review-hangout-hipaa-health/ (not free and HIPAA compliant)

issues.title: CAMOS module support for ICD10
issues.body: CAMOS module is currently hard-coded for ICD9. Need to have it be more flexible and support all codes that are marked as diagnostic codes (also may need to do the same for the billing codes).

issues.title: Improve drug-drug interaction checking
issues.body:
Sherwin recently contributed code that is a nice starting point for drug-drug interaction which was brought into the codebase:
https://github.com/openemr/openemr/commit/43694fd3a580bf4425624737a54454a1e7923dd0

The option for turning it on and quick instructions for use can be found here:
http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Administration_Globals#Rx_NLM_Drug-Drug

The algorithm for collecting the rxcui list of the patient is here:
https://github.com/openemr/openemr/blob/43694fd3a580bf4425624737a54454a1e7923dd0/interface/weno/drug-drug.php#L36-L42

It basically converts drugs to rxcui numbers and then checks the interactions via online call to nih service. At this point, it basically does the following:
1. Uses drug title names in prescriptions, which are then converted to rxcui via the RXNORM database included within OpenEMR(note only searches for the first word of the prescription drug title if there are more than 1 words).

Recommend also adding the following to improve the capturing of the patient meds/drugs:
1. Check the medication drug titles (ie. following as is done above).
2. Use the rxnorm_drugcode sql column in the prescription table (this should be a rxcui code) if it exists.
3. Use the rxcui code that are included in the diagnosis column of the lists table for the medication items.

issues.title: Open Encounter listing at top of tab layout not getting populated
issues.body: The Open Encounter listing at top of tab layout is not getting populated when save a new encounter

issues.title: Fix the translations of title elements in the Zend modules
issues.body: The title elements of the Zend modules are not correctly using the translations engine (only in about 5 places). Can fix by mimicking what was done in the PatientValidation Zend module to support translation of the title element.

issues.title: tab layout - ability to drag and drop the tabs
issues.body: Add ability to be able to drag and drop the tabs (ie. reorganize them) in the tabs layout.

issues.title: tab layout - support keyboard shortcuts
issues.body: Support keyboard shortcuts in the tab layout.

pull_requests.title: Zbig01 backup update 1
pull_requests.body:
User interface improvements to the Administration->Backup along with a help script. Taken from the following PR:
https://github.com/openemr/openemr/pull/1235

Also fixes to the commandline restore script:
"The first thing that I noted was that whatever your database and openemr installation was called the recovered one would be called openemr. Secondly the restore script assumed the Web root directory to be /var/www/
I order to fix these problems I created a text file that contains the installation data, openemr-setup.txt, and modified the restore script to accept these values as needed. This now results in the recovered installation to be identical in all respects to the original. In addition the restore script is now included in the emr_backup.tar which now contains 2 archives and two files - openemr-setup.txt and restore."

Demo is here:
http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Development_Demo#Epsilon_-_Up_For_Grabs_Demo

issue_comments.body:
Very cool. Do these pull requests go to other users?
I'm assuming they test fine. I'll rebase these commits into one and commit to sourceforge.
thanks,
-brady

hey,
I can see it on my bradymiller account since I'm watching the main openemr repo. It's a nice way to get code submitted and reviewed, although can't use the merge feature (code needs to be committed to sourceforge and then mirrored to github). When you send a pull request, would also be useful to put a message in the sourceforge developer forum and link to the pull request there, so other developers can easily review the code also. Also useful to know your github branch that it came from, because then it's very easy to test you code (simply fetch the branch) locally.
-brady

That's too bad about needing to put it into you master branch, because it's now not gonna be compatible with the official master branch. If this is the only way to do this, then won't be useful. To fix your repo, will need to do:
git checkout master
git reset --hard f4556c1c27a1e84606af
git push origin +master

Hi whimmel,
Since the gihub repository is only a mirror (from the official sourceforge repo), we can't take advantage of the pull mechanism here at github. Please post your github branch in the Sourceforge 'Code Review' tracker, and I'd also suggest posting a message regarding this in the Developer Forum since it will be good to get multiple developers to look at and review this code since it's in a central location (it appears it will also avoid the bugs some have been having with our current mechanism to auto determine the absolut/web roots)
thanks,
-brady
Very confused what is going on here. Never accepted this pull request and appears to be "merging" in commits that already exist. Guessing some sort of github bug; have asked github to look into this.

Hi Ted,

This stuff looks pretty cool. We don't use the github pull requests for reviews/commits since the OpenEMR github repo is just a mirror (the main codebase is kept on git repo on sourceforge). To get the code reviewed and committed, you need to request this on the sourceforge OpenEMR forums (or on the Code Review tracker on sourceforge); http://sourceforge.net/projects/openemr/forums . In your message, ensure to post a link to your github commit/branch. I am guessing that yehster (Kevin) will be very interested in looking through this code.

Hi garcianc,

The OpenEMR project does not use github to pull in code to the codebase (and none of the developers except myself will see these pull requests). To get the code reviewed and into the codebase, you need to post a link to your github commit(s) or branch(es) on the sourceforge developer forum:
http://sourceforge.net/p/openemr/discussion/202506/

Check out our developer documentation here:
http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/OpenEMR_Wiki_Home_Page#Developer_Manuals

Regarding placing new indexes, you add them to both the database.sql and 4_1_1-to-4_1_2_upgrade.sql scripts. Your database.sql looks ok. This is how would do it in the upgrade script (note that these comments are actually functions utilized by the upgrade scripts; see the top of the upgrade script for the function descriptions):

```
#IfNotIndex form_encounter encounter
CREATE INDEX encounter on form_encounter (encounter);
#EndIf

#IfNotIndex form_encounter encounter_date
CREATE INDEX encounter_date on form_encounter (date); 
#EndIf
```

thanks,
-brady

Code looks very nice! I didn't test it, though, but not necessary to move forward.

To fully separate this, would add a separate tab to Administration->Other->External Data Loads with title SNOMED (RF2). I would change the current SNOMED tab title to SNOMED (RF1). This will then allow different instruction sets and full separation of the importing.

Then to get your new SNOMED tables working in OpenEMR, will need to support them in custom/code_types.inc.php:
1. Check out line 23 "external" codes, which is where the money is. You will be first focusing on gettting the codes 3, 8, and 10 working (ie. the basics), by supporting them via the define_external_table function in that file (see below the function to see how the other code types including SNOMED RF1 are set up).
2. Then to get it to work, will need to add these external codes as options in line 169 $cd_external_options. This is what populates the External selector in the Lists gui at Administration->Lists->Code Types; so you can select the RF2 choices rather than the current RF1's for SNOMED and see what happens.

Then when those pieces are in place, can then focus on getting this feature into the official codebase and begin to  support all the other possible SNOMED goodness features.

2. since there seems to be a cache issue (I had to empty my browser cache for the new theme changes to show up)

Also will be helpful to rebase these all into 1 commit and redo the pull request (when they are all in 1 commit, then can have github ignore whitespacing changes when viewing the commit via ?w=0, so can focus on the meaningful code changes on the review). Then can also point a up for grabs demo at it to gets folks to test it out.

-brady

Something else is the Deceased alert. I noted that it has lost it's styling on the old themes and is not very obvious on your new theme (Note from a clinical standpoint, it should be very obvious that a patient is deceased when go into the electronic record).

Hi tony,

Here was my analysis on this:
http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php?title=Active_Projects&oldid=10031#Assigned_Provider_ID_and_Referring_Provider_ID_conflict_bug

The claims uses ref_providerID now (was using providerID).

The collection report it looks like I missed. I think it needs to be switched from providerID to ref_providerID:

```
$query = "SELECT f.id, f.date, f.pid, f.encounter, f.last_level_billed, " .
  "f.last_level_closed, f.last_stmt_date, f.stmt_count, f.invoice_refno, " .
  "p.fname, p.mname, p.lname, p.street, p.city, p.state, " .
  "p.postal_code, p.phone_home, p.ss, p.genericname2, p.genericval2, " .
  "p.pubpid, p.DOB, CONCAT(u.lname, ', ', u.fname) AS referrer, " .
  "( SELECT SUM(b.fee) FROM billing AS b WHERE " .
  "b.pid = f.pid AND b.encounter = f.encounter AND " .
  "b.activity = 1 AND b.code_type != 'COPAY' ) AS charges, " .
  "( SELECT SUM(b.fee) FROM billing AS b WHERE " .
  "b.pid = f.pid AND b.encounter = f.encounter AND " .
  "b.activity = 1 AND b.code_type = 'COPAY' ) AS copays, " .
  "( SELECT SUM(s.fee) FROM drug_sales AS s WHERE " .
  "s.pid = f.pid AND s.encounter = f.encounter ) AS sales, " .
  "( SELECT SUM(a.pay_amount) FROM ar_activity AS a WHERE " .
  "a.pid = f.pid AND a.encounter = f.encounter ) AS payments, " .
  "( SELECT SUM(a.adj_amount) FROM ar_activity AS a WHERE " .
  "a.pid = f.pid AND a.encounter = f.encounter ) AS adjustments " .
  "FROM form_encounter AS f " .
  "JOIN patient_data AS p ON p.pid = f.pid " .
  "LEFT OUTER JOIN users AS u ON u.id = p.providerID " .
  "WHERE $where " .
  "ORDER BY f.pid, f.encounter";
$eres = sqlStatement($query);
```

Otherwise, both referrer and referrerID were not actually used or collected in OpenEMR, so I could not assume what they were (ie. is the id and id from the user table or some other id). Because of this discrepancy and the fact they are not used in the codebase, I created a new entry ref_providerID, which stores the id from the user table. I must say this was one of the oddest bugs, a database field was storing both the primary physician and referring physician id (so, you could either bill correctly or calculate AMC per physician correctly, but could not do both...). And the solution I came up with was all I could think of to squash the bug and work seamlessly for upgraders.

Need to clean up master branch etc(not too tough). Need to run now, but I'll provide specific commands to do this later this evening.

```
#ok, first need to deal with your master, which is now dirty (suggest keeping master mirrored to official codebase):
git checkout master
# copy your current master branch to a daysheet branch and post it to github
git checkout -b daysheet_1
git push origin daysheet_1
# now replace your current master branch
# remove them
git branch -D master
git push origin :master
# now replace them with the official master branch
git fetch upstream
git checkout upstream/master
git checkout -b master
git push origin master
# Now need to update your daysheet branch to most recent codebase
git checkout daysheet_1
git checkout -b daysheet_2
git rebase master
git push origin daysheet_2
# Extra credit is to rebase all your commits into one
# replace <number of commits> with how many commits you are squashing into one commit
git checkout daysheet_3
git rebase -i HEAD~<number_of_commits>
NOW, in the editor, keep "pick" on top line and change others to "squash", then save and exit
NOW, in editor, modify this comment, which will be new comment for the squashed commit, then save and exit
git push origin daysheet_3
```

review_comments.body:
Hi Art,

Need to keep your master branch clean or things will go to hell (I am exaggerating a bit, of course :) ).

Don't merge into your master like this. Then you won't know what you are testing on on all the branches based on this. To clean up, suggest on your local repo doing following:

```
# Go to master
git checkout master
# Reset your master to the commit prior to the merge commit
git reset --hard 24978cf2557ab527e83d7c58c6f1e48c6c8e842d
# Now overwrite your local branch master to your github repo (I am assuming you call it 'origin')
git push origin +master
```

And in future, when you want to feed your master from official codebase, follow these instructions:
http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Git_for_dummies#Step_3:_Feeding_your_repository

-brady

issues.title: Thoughts on Tabs?
issues.body:
We have what I presume is some home-grown tabs code with the tabbify() function in library/js/common.js. It's not very capable, for example doesn't support dynamic adding and removing of tabs.

The Tabs layout is based on Knockout JS, not my cup of tea.

I noticed the [jQuery UI Tabs widget](https://jqueryui.com/tabs/). That looks pretty good. Anyone have experience with it? Other ideas?

My immediate interest here is turning the encounter frame into a tabbed area with each form that you open in its own tab.

issues.title: Closing a tab not warning of unsaved changes
issues.body:
Using Tabs layout, I tested making a change in a patient's demographics and then closing the tab without saving the change.  The tab closed and there was no warning.  Also tested the same thing in the layout editor page (Administration -> Layouts) with the same result.  Did not test other pages but I suspect it's a general problem with all.

Also regarding closing tabs, I see that the page is left empty and no existing tab is shown in its place.  This seems wrong.

commits.message: Fix for issue 685: reopening encounter through void on fee sheet fails (#1322)
Fix for browser error on fee sheet save.

Support for tabbed encounters. (#1263)

* Support for tabbed encounters.

issue_comments.body:
Suggest replacing the tabs with spaces; different text editors will interpret tabs differently.

Also those subselects are wrong. Insurance in effect depends on the encounter date, you don't want to just pick the most recent insurance. See function getEffectiveInsurances() in patient.inc.

Offhand it looks OK to me except the indenting is messed up.

Rod

Thanks for your work on this.  Conditionals were originally designed for LBF encounter forms and we really needed to get them working elsewhere.  I have not tested but the code looks reasonable.

Rod

I also vaguely remember stored procedures (and I assume triggers) complicating permissions for backup/restore.  In any case I would prefer a different solution.  Atomicity doesn't matter for data integrity because PHP is not multi-threaded and probably never will be.

You can't use a SELECT subquery with INSERT with the same table in each, but try INSERT...SELECT with aggregation like this:

`SqlStatement("INSERT INTO ar_activity (pid, encounter, sequence_no, code_type, ...) SELECT pid, encounter, COALESCE(MAX(sequence_no), 0) + 1, ?, ... FROM ar_activity WHERE pid = ? AND encounter = ? GROUP BY pid, encounter", array($codetype, ..., $pid, $encounter));`

I don't think deletes are going to matter.
I can't imagine my solution above producing deadlocks as it's a single query.

@olegsv This merits a few comments.
1. Your point is taken that a single statement can produce a 1213 error, however that's not really an "error", it's just mysql asking you to wait a few milliseconds and try again.
2. This applies to command line PHP where real concurrency can happen, however that's not the case with a PHP web script.
3. The statement you tested is not the one I proposed. I'm surprised you did not get a syntax error, as MySQL's documentation of subqueries says "you cannot modify a table and select from the same table in a subquery". Please read my post again carefully.
4. Thanks for making me do some reading about ACID with InnoDB.  :)

If you use CLI then I think you need to also test for error 1213, and when it occurs pause for a few msec and try the query again.  I understand that is just an oddity of how MySQL works.

I'm pretty sure CLI is different from web with respect to PHP concurrency.

Yes that query looks like what I mean.
By the way try the usleep() function for the pause operation.  But I would not do that for a web script.
To expand a bit on CLI vs. web... PHP with Apache depends on apache2-mpm-prefork which is the non-threaded Apache model, because mod_php is not thread-safe.
What results are those?  What error?

No I have not tried it.  How can you be getting error 1213 if you are pausing and re-trying when getting that?  If you are just giving up after a few pauses then I think you are expecting too much.  You have several processes continually fighting over the same record lock so there will be a LOT of conflicts.

Try the attached.  Empty table won't work here, you have to pre-seed with one entry and the real code will need to do something about that.

[test_insert.php.txt](https://github.com/openemr/openemr/files/276546/test_insert.php.txt)

Here's a version that works with no existing rows.

[test_insert.php.txt](https://github.com/openemr/openemr/files/276569/test_insert.php.txt)

issues.title: Sepsis Screening Tool
issues.body:
Hi Community,
Looking for some questions answered with regards to this...
I will try and explain the best I can.

**Background**
One of the main clinical systems we use in the UK is called SystmOne - it has the ability to create custom protocols (similar to macros) which are triggered by certain events in the patient record. 
One of the protocols which someone has written for it is a Sepsis Screening Tool. Sepsis kills over 40,000 people in the UK every year.

My aim is to build a similar tool for OpenEMR which takes into account ICD9 and 10 codes, keywords and vital measurements e.g. temperature to assess a patient for Sepsis and if necessary flag a warning up to the doctor.

Image: An example of the popup we get in SystmOne. In this case I typed in the history that the patient had a fever and increased heart rate and this popup was triggered.
![screenshot 2017-08-20 21 50 38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4623934/29591051-b9592df6-8794-11e7-91f6-7d58059e5631.png)

PDF File: An example of the protocol which would be followed for diagnosis
https://www.nuh.nhs.uk/media/1725749/newsstforobs_chart.pdf

**Questions**

Developers - how would you best integrate this feature into OpenEMR? I am aware that there are clinical reminders in each patient - but this is more for routine items and only loads when the record is refreshed. 

I have had a quick play with some code and have some code sitting in the `save.php`code which saves the encounter. If the word 'fever' is seen in the consultation notes, it presents a javascript alert. Obviously in the production version it would be a bit more complex - we would look at ICD9/10 codes and vitals measurements as well (and even the age of the patient is a factor) to get a better picture. 
I would probably put the main bulk of the code in /library and then php require it in to `save.php` so it acts as a middleware of sorts. 

This brings me neatly on to my second question... in my brief example I have entered data only into the main brief description field.

![screenshot 2017-08-22 23 57 53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4623934/29591332-fd097ce4-8795-11e7-9e7f-1c7e7e1e726d.png)
 
As we all know, OpenEMR has so many various forms (SOAP, Treatment Plan etc) where this info could be written that my mind is spinning working just how to handle all these different sources! Advice appreciated. Maybe we need to poll some of the users of OpenEMR where they enter the most of their information. Do they code everything such as 'fever', and enter temperature into the right form, or are they lazy and just free-text it all into one box? 

If this is the case, I also have some code in the works which would take the phrase...
"patient has a temperature of 39" and extract the 39 so we can perform operations on it. Obviously this wouldn't be perfect and I haven't worked out how to handle people using fahrenheit or celsius. I don't want so many false positives that users start ignoring the alerts.

**Disclaimer**

Obviously this goes without saying but this would be a tool to aid, not replace clinical judgement. In an ideal scenario a popup will be generated explaining WHY the system thinks the patient is a sespsis risk along with a pathway for the doctor to follow to further screen patient. 

I would LIKE the feature to be on by default, with the option of turning it off... purely because of the amount of lives claimed by Sepsis. However, if we need to turn it off by default I will oblige!

pull_requests.title: Self checkin feature
pull_requests.body:
# Patient Self Checkin Feature

This feature allows patients to check themselves in for their appointment using a touch screen kiosk, for example this - (http://www.jayex.com/images/slideshows/patient-check-in//17in-kiosks.jpg) 
However, OpenEMR is web based - all you need is a web browser, so a spare iPad/tablet could be wall mounted and used for the checking in of patients.

The feature is found at http(s)://YourServerHere/portal/patient_self_checkin/

**Why is it useful?**

It frees up reception staff to answer the phone, deal with prescription queries etc. When the patient checks themself in, the same features are performed as when the reception checks them in. That is, the encounter is created, the status is updated to (@ Arrived) and the [flow board](http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Patient_Flow_Board) also reflects the time they checked in and starts the clock counting.

**Checks performed**
In an effort to ensure my code is as reliable as possible, I have performed the following checks

- The same patient cannot check in twice
- Only patients with appointments today can check in
- If a patient has 2 appointments on the same day, nothing untoward happens, they are simply checked in for both simultaneously. The only time I can think of this happening is, for example, if they have an appointment with the Dr and then the nurse, say for phlebotomy services. Maybe the community can clarify for me?
-  This feature can be enabled and disabled via the global preferences pane.

**Documentation**
I am working on docs - just let me know where to send them/post them. Not sure if they need to go in the wiki/user guide or whereever?

**Screenshots**
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/x8te9ba23c5iaa0/AAComgUSKMv5bvyG80rBMWcHa?dl=0 

**Demo**
http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Development_Demo#Gamma_-_Up_For_Grabs_Demo

issues.title: upgrade and patch
issues.body:
Currently the project relies on [documented guidelines](http://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/Securing_OpenEMR) for preventing intentional mischief or accidental actions.

Is there any reason why at least the sql upgrade and/or patching functionality should not require an administrative login?

If acl checks are added, these scripts could also be ideal candidates for use of 'App' functionality.

On a related note, would it make sense for upgrade to also include patch?

commits.message:
Update documents import utility

Optional setting of owner for all imported documents.

issue_comments.body:
[This commit](https://github.com/mdsupport/openemr/commit/0c295b3ab8bbd16d30743adad352f36c33d09294) has insert_features code which centralizes several code components into a single function call.  It also implemented include_once for scripts and stylesheets.  Although we use it in all our code, few months ago, based on [this discussion](http://sourceforge.net/p/openemr/discussion/202506/thread/c1a0eab7/) there was little interest in any central control.  Reason for bringing this was for stuff like patient search which your core class will need to address.  When you do that, it would be good if that is a general purpose utility class rather than a point solution.  
Great work.
If Zend is to become core requirement, please consider moving it to vendor directory and using composer.  Putting entire framework deep within any of the project's 'standard' directories is unusual.

interface/modules/zend_modules/vendor is Zend's vendor directory.  Zend will be our vendor as 
openemr/vendor/zf2/...

commit_comments.body: getListItemTitle does not return the seq which is used here to list reminders in a consistent order (due, cat and action).  Had thought about altering that function but it currently returns string so it will break other calls.

Sure. 'Actions' is not necessary.  Thx.
A word of caution in dealing with rules - report is likely to timeout if someone runs report for 100s of appointments.
FYI: We use customized theme where css provides alternating colors for all report-results.  The include at end brings in jQuery code that cleans up styles and makes all reports consistent.

issues.title: Editing Facility Breaks Out of Tabs
issues.body:
Upon editing a facility, clicking save correctly returns to the Facility list page, but it doesn't apply it to the iframe, it changes the entire window.

Occurs on the `bootstrap-facility-page` branch, not on master.

This is a fancybox issue - I'll fix it.

issues.title: Standardize Buttons
issues.body:
Long running issue to standardize all buttons in OpenEMR.

Currently buttons are `<a>` `<button>` and (from what I can see most commonly) `<input>` types.

Goal is to standardize this to `button` (Or `<a>` if there's a good reason)

issues.title: Standardize PID datatypes in DB
issues.body:
Currently `pid` column in `patient_data` has a type of `BIGINT` and a length of `20` but on `patient_access_onsite` (and offsite) the `pid` column is `INT` with a length of `11` - this has security implications if a pid with length > 11 is inserted into the portal tables.

Planning on standardizing the column types/lengths/etc so everything lines up, will likely use a GUID/UUID solution which will bring us one step closer to offsite OpenEMR usage

issues.title: Consolidate writable directories to one directory
issues.body:
Currently we require several folders be writable:

* openemr/sites/default/documents
* openemr/sites/default/edi
* openemr/sites/default/era
* openemr/sites/default/letter_templates
* openemr/gacl/admin/templates_c
* openemr/interface/main/calendar/modules/PostCalendar/pntemplates/compiled
* openemr/interface/main/calendar/modules/PostCalendar/pntemplates/cache

Would like to consolidate this to just `sites/*/documents`

issues.title: Archive Patient Data
issues.body:
Currently no mechanism exists for archiving a patient. By having a UI option to archive PT or a script which runs daily/weekly/monthly/whenever we could keep the query load and resulting dataset smaller.

Ideally, archived data would be packaged up and moved to a different table (Would need to create a UI option to "Include Archived Data") could also just have a bool field on the main patient table

issue_comments.body: I have no problem with composer, I use it in nearly every project I write. Is the consensus to implement that? If so, I'll go back and work that in.

That's good news. I'll work on that later tonight, perhaps Wednesday depending on how work goes.

For the inclined: https://getcomposer.org/doc/01-basic-usage.md#autoloading

Autoloading is now handled by composer. Add a module by adding it to the list of psr-4 autoloaders in composer.json and then run `composer dump-autoload` to get the updated autoload files into vendor.
Any movement on this @bradymiller?

My goal is to move over core code into a modular system. For example, all interaction with a Patient would happen at the class-level. Since Patient is a core module, it'd stay under the library folder. I'm looking at adding a top level "public" folder, where front-end assets would eventually migrate. So public/assets/js/some-cool-jquery-plugin.js.

We should mitigate jquery version conflicts using some PHP logic, but I think it'd be better to implement a tighter standard on what jquery versions we allow in the code.

Vendor packages generally kept under the top level "vendor" folder, which currently doesn't exist. I'm all for keeping vendor-specific code in the vendor/<vendor-name> folder format. 

I don't know much about how 3rd party modules are handled now, so I have no input on the registry table.

There is no easy way to extend this architecture to current code - current code would need to be refactored into a better structure.
@bradymiller Any feedback on this PR?

I know Zend has an autoloader - I just wasn't sure if we can reliably use the Zend stuff outside of what ZH brought it in for.

The reason I keep pestering is because this provides a lot f the base for my UI stuff. But if I can use the Zend autoloader stuff, I will look into that also.
I agree that Zend should be in the vendor folder - I've thought this from the beginning.

If we wanted to use standard practice, ALL non-openemr code would be under /vendor. This would include ZF2, as well as any modules ZF2 may rely on. 

Have we considered using composer to manage things like this? getcomposer.org

I made the font smaller as there is so much information on this screen I thought it prudent to sacrifice some font size to better layout the content. I agree it's smaller than the ideal, but I think it's a solid compromise due to the large horizontal axis of info.

I feel like the title doesn't need to stand out as much as it did - people know that at the top of a table of data there is usually a header.

I need to look at the blinking issue.

Also, I'm going to submit some better default colors for the appointment statuses. I think the colors as they are now are much too saturated. I'm attaching a screenshot of the colors I want to move towards. 

![screen shot 2015-08-04 at 02 29 39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1381170/9054561/bd326ae8-3a50-11e5-9a5f-b73ccd2f0bd3.jpg)

Thoughts on axing the PID column, moving the encounter to the Patient column and just appending the patient. Example: Last name, First name [encounterID]. Maybe renaming "Exam Room #" to just Room # and "Arrival Time" to "Arrived" and "Current Status Time" to just "Status Time"?

This would reduce the number of columns and the overall width of the table which means we _might_ be able to bump the font-size back up.
Hm. Yeah, without the foundation library everything would break. I’ll commit the library and re-submit

I'd happily work on converting from wiki to these markdown based docs; most projects keep their documentation inside the repo anyway. There's a great utility called `pandoc` that allows easy conversion to/from various text formats. I used this to convert 95% of the pages in this PR and then went in by hand and tidied up the last 5%. This has a couple of benefits. First, it allows us to get eyes on all of our docs and make sure they are up-to-date. Second, It gives an opportunity to improve the docs, it's always good to review documentation.

As for keeping two separate doc bases (which is unreasonable), updating these docs is actually very easy. A user can actually do it right on GitHub (they support editing files inline and since this is just a text file it's simple. It's essentially the fork/edit/PR we all know and love.

Actually, it's even easier than I thought, RTD has an "Edit" button built in to the docs, although it's not working right now (I think it's because I have RTD setup to read from my feature branch and not the master branch)

Can we run some statistics to see if the wiki is being contributed to by a significant number of non-programmers? It seems that the entry would be about the same between learning wiki and markdown, especially considering RTD has the edit button which takes the user right to the markdown source.

If it turns out that the wiki is being contributed to mostly by programmers I say we reconsider this issue. Github allows such a fluid workflow it is worth reviewing, in my opinion.

PHPDoc is still the king of PHP auto-documentation. Here's some templates http://phpdoc.org/templates. I'll generate some docs and see what we can do. The big difference between the Wiki documentation and the developer docs is the automation factor. I'll see what I can do over the weekend

The old themes are slightly affected but I tried to keep those changes to a minimum. Let me see if I can find a way to make even fewer changes.

Text size and colors noted and will fix.

Ok, brought back the demographics page to master, added some classes (and tidied up some white space and indentation. I also updated the font sizes and fixed the white labels on a white background.

I was also able to keep most of the changes I originally wanted, you can see the up for grabs demo tomorrow after it resets.
@bradymiller I know you have plenty of PR's to deal with, have you had a chance to review the changes here?

Also, I am going to begin writing some documentation on the "anatomy of a theme" and use my SASS based theme as a guide for future development.

The thought process goes a little something like this:
- Every `<body>` tag will get a class with the following syntax: `folder-subfolder-page_name` so for instance `patient_file-summary-demographics` is patient_file/summary/demographics.php
- In the SCSS files there is a `.patient_file-summary-demographics` tag with any and all definitions for that particular page. This allows each page to be styled uniquely and not bloat the main CSS namespace.
- SCSS files can be included in other SCSS files. Bootstrap is a common example (They break out each component into it's own .scss file)
- There is a style_light.scss which includes all the sub pages

This way we are able to easily locate specific changes but the compiled, finished CSS is still just one file.I'll put together some documentation, tidy up my git repo and post to the wiki
Actually, scratch that idea.... that ties CSS classes to file locations, which is a bad idea. I'll come up with some other way of naming
Will make sure my tidying code and real changes are separate in the future

issues.title: Patient Portal Admin "owner" ID conflicts with portal users' IDs
issues.body:
I'm using the Onsite Version 2 patient portal, and there appears to be a conflict of `owner` IDs in the `onsite_mail` table which results in patient 1 being able to see patient 2's messages, etc.

I have two patients in the system `A` and `B` with pids `1` and `2` respectively.

When I am logged in as the administrator (the one that was set up during installation), and I navigate to the Patient Messaging center (Miscellaneous->Portal Dashboard->Patient Mail). 

I compose a new message to `Patient B` (pid 2). Two records are created in the `onsite_mail` table. One has an `owner` of 1 and one has an `owner` of 2 (`Patient B`). The problem is: Now `Patient A` (pid 1) logs in and can see the message that the admin sent `Patient B` (pid 2) because the `owner` of the message sent by the administrator is 1. I'm assuming this number is the admin's user id from the `users_secure` table.

Am I misunderstanding something with the patient portal? Is anyone able to replicate this issue? Any help would be appreciated.

issues.title: Better Living through chemistry (Better drugs for the system)
issues.body:
Greetings All -
I've been exploring the project, kicking around the idea of enhancing the drug section, and decided that I would.

The first big thing I did was to explore the available free datasets out there, looking to find a complete one, that is free to non-commercial use and supported. It also had to cover interactions. I found Drugbank and started exploring it, and toying with the data. I'm going to side step the online API with the initial crack at this due to the need for speed, but hey - maybe later. 

Considered design highpoints -
I'm a huge fan of entity factory models, and my concept is the following -
- Drug Entity Factory (Responsible for generating a factory based on the data set)
-- Drugbank Entity 
--- Search Feature
--- Basic Drug info (name, who makes it, etc)
--- Dosage 
--- Drug Ingredients
----- Drug Interactions
----- Food Interactions
(Yes - this will be heavily object-centric)

Tables and Data Schema
I initially thought 'This would be awesome for a json store' and then thought 'lets not' and I'll stay traditional. This is what I'm targeting for my MVP,
- Drug
-- IID (pk internal id), EID (supplied by vendor), Name, Desc, indication
- Interaction 
-- Drug EID 
-- Interaction Type (food, drug),  
-- Name
-- Description


UI 
- Essentially  
-- a simple, or complex (customizable to some degree based on user desires) overlay for the clinicians rx that would display drug info. 
-- driven by pt info, a possible drug interaction warning would display
-- ability to print drug info for PT


Anyway - I'm working out the core modules now. A few questions since I'm new -
How best to communicate with the group about the models? 
I LOVE AXURE for both UI and flow modeling, does this work with the group to communicate?
I am also comfortable with EA.... 

Thoughts?

issues.title: Snomed RF2 support
issues.body:
This September 2016 US Edition of SNOMED CT marks the last RF1 release. Going forward the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO) and NLM will only produce the RF2 release files for SNOMED CT. This includes the International and US Editions of SNOMED CT. At this time our External Database Import Utility does not support Snomed RF2.
The solution to this issue is to add a new functionality that will implement the database load processing of Snomed_RF2 files into OpenEmr
I’ll be working in this endeavor, If someone wish to get involved or provide input is very welcome.

issues.title: Canvas drawing uploads fails if thumbnail checked
issues.body:
When storing canvas drawings, the drawings are sent to the server as $_POST['imgBase64'] in base64 encoding (at least the Eye Form works this way).  The images are processed by the addNewDocument function, called in save.php.
forms/eye_mag/save.php around line 912:
`$return = addNewDocument($filename,$type,$_POST["imgBase64"],0,$size,$_SESSION['authUserID'],$pid,$category_id);
`
If the Global->Document->Generate thumbnail is checked, the addNewDocument fails and throws an error.  It works without this checked.

Short answer: I have no idea what I am doing! 

GitHub updated its program and now it keeps crashing. Very frustrating.  

There is a lot of code there - would be nice to have access to programmers. What I hacked up in 4 months they'd have done in a few weeks!  

Though there are a lot of changes the form is functioning well enough I think for testing by a wide audience. 

I am nearly done removing the extract $_REQUEST AND $_SESSION.  

I did not address the table changes for past ocular hx etc yet.

There is no delete eye_mag and revert back to original unscathed yet. 

 I haven't started the higher order logic for customizing the form on a user basis over time - this will be interesting but I do not think it is needed to get a functioning form out the door.  

I am learning how to integrate a form into openemr and use the pre existing code.  

The ROS needs to be done.  I will revise the preexisting form and link to it using the menu system you built in the framed version.  In the full screen view, there is a new menu which I am getting ready to tackle. I will need to see how the framed menu is built to learn how items are chosen for display to do it correctly.  

The imp plan needs to be built. It is just two pitiful fields today. With user actions, we should be able to prepopulate the icd9/10 codes. Also it should have a way of displaying past codes... It needs to have separate sections for each issue, so it may need a new table.  

Although you can have more than one Chief complaint, I limited the form to three.  If someone needs more, then it will require a new table too. The new table will allow a one-to-many relationship. One encounter, many options. I see this as possible with not only the chief complaint and the imp plan area but also refractions and glasses.  Some people show up with 5 pairs of glasses and the eye doc has to figure out what's up! 

Well with that the form should be something an eyedoc would actually enjoy using. Key is to wrap it up in such a way that it speeds up the encounter.  That is my real goal. 

Ray

Updated the translation for the general form and deleted the bak files. Updated some code changes to better process multiple authorization codes and select the correct one for the CPT that is being billed.

My apologies, I did not see the questions. However, I think it would be
best to make this v2. It is backwards compatible because the table labels
are in the same name convention. They were not changed. So, if someone were
to use version 2, the previous data would show including comments.

The form does not account for account for upgrading the database to the new
table layout. I had not explored how to make it upgrade able.
The changes to the Claim,class.php file and the gen_x12_837.inc.php files
adds the functionality of the auth being entered into the correct segment
of the 837. That is backwards compatible.

However, I am not sure that the new form can be installed atop of the old
one since they would share the same database table name. It can't be done
from the user interface. Let me know how you would like to proceed.

pull_requests.body:
Rewrite of the calendar_arrived function to synchronize recurring rt2 appts to the calendar.

Fixes this bug also...

For recurring appts set on the same day as payment ($today) status of rt1 or rt2 event is changed to '@'
instead of the date ($today) being converted to an rt0 event with status '@'.

Notes...

the code calculating rt2 appts in the original calendar_arrived function disagrees with the calendar however since __increment is used to calculate rt1 appts it already responds to the weekend setting in admin for appts set with the "workday" option.

The calendar_arrived function is called when a payment is made for the current day ( Fees > Payments ) and no encounter exists for that day.

Code in front_payment.php ( line 170 ) calls calendar_arrived and this is the only call to calendar_arrived.

$zero_enc occurs three times in the codebase, once in front_payment.php and twice in calendar_arrived
and does not seem to do anything.

For more than one appt the updated appts (status) are likely written to the database in different order with
the new code.

issue_comments.body:
Yes, they test fine.  I'm not sure if anyone else gets the requests.  Maybe the other "followers" can see them?  Or perhaps the other "owners" who have access to push to the master repository get the requests too? I think they show up in on the "Pull Requests" tab for all to see and comment on while open.

Since the issue is now closed though it might not be visible to others.

I was only able to submit the "Pull Request" after I merged it into my own master repository.  It wouldn't let me submit it from the branch, but I think that the link to the commits included in the pull request indicates which branch it came from if not.    Hard to tell for sure since I committed in both my master and deprecatedremoval branches.  Understood about posting in the SF forums.

The modifications for multi-column key/auto insert needs to be tested when there is concurrency, and for verification that the transnational semantics work properly.  It's possible that there might also need to be an explicit lock on the table to ensure that the sequence_no is generated properly.
I'm also not sure what happens if the table is still MyIASM, since transaction's don't really do anything in that case.

The best approach might be to make determining the next sequence number a subquery of the insert statement rather than using two separate statements.  This way, it's still a single atomic operation even if the table is still MyIASM.  This isn't the exact syntax to work, but it's close enough to give the general idea.

```
                 sqlStatement("insert into ar_activity set "    .
                "pid = '"       . trim(formData("HiddenPId$CountRow"   )) .
                "', encounter = '"     . trim(formData("HiddenEncounter$CountRow"   ))  .
                "', sequence_no = '"     . SELECT IFNULL(MAX(sequence_no),0) + 1 AS increment FROM ar_activity WHERE pid = ? AND encounter = ?", (trim(formData("HiddenPId$CountRow"   )), trim(formData("HiddenEncounter$CountRow"   )  .
                                     "', code_type = '"      . trim(formData("HiddenCodetype$CountRow"   ))  .
                "', code = '"      . trim(formData("HiddenCode$CountRow"   ))  .
                "', modifier = '"      . trim(formData("HiddenModifier$CountRow"   ))  .

                "', adj_amount = '"    . 0 .
                "', account_code = '" . "$AccountCode"  .
```

My suggestion when we were discussing this on Sourceforge a month ago was that Oleg and his team could use triggers for their own purposes in their own branch, because of the objections that were going to come up over using them in the official branch.

Atomicity of transactions matters even in single threaded/non-concurrent applications. That is why PHP provides support for them in the database libraries.  If it didn't matter why would mysqli and ADODB bother with the function calls for begin, commit and rollback?

https://sourceforge.net/p/openemr/discussion/202506/thread/2244a470/?page=1

> Note, I'm not proposing we use triggers for the core project. It's a possible solution for matrix to be able to use InnoDB with the incompatible tables with minimal modification to PHP code.

There may not actually be any PHP code which deletes records from the 4 tables.

Thanks for the clarification that the trigger is only for delete.

Not sure about TEXT DEFAULT etc...
However, I wonder if using a temporary table to generate the next sequence number might work instead of needing the permanent sequence tables.  That might avoid the need for the delete triggers.

No, a temp table won't hold values between restarts  It might not be the right approach.  

I guess I don't understand why there are deadlocks when trying to generate the sequence_no without the sequence table.  My thought with the temp table was that by making the temp table the shared resource that each transaction waited on deadlocks might be avoided.  

The first time a seq_no needs to be generated in a session, the "main" table would need to be queried with ifnull max/etc... but for subsequent operations it could be generated from the temp table.

The other thing is, it might not be a big deal if the sequence numbers don't "reset" when data in the main table is deleted.  I actually don't think the behavior of autoincrement in MySQL is to reuse lower numbers after deletion.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2214141/auto-increment-after-delete-in-mysql

It's unlikely that there would every be that much concurrent activity in these tables, based on what they represent.

It might be appropriate to make a trade-off between "no-triggers" and "maximum potential performance".

$mods = preg_split("/[: ]/",trim($this->procs[$prockey]['modifier']));

Even though ":" was documented as the delimiter to use for multiple modifiers, it really wasn't correct since doing so would have resulted in incorrect CMS1500 claims. Won't break anything, but MySQL will have to work ever so slightly harder  and use more space than if only the one index exist.

It seems much cleaner to me to just explicitly use ADODB ExecuteNoLog for a number of reasons.  Eliminating the extra logic in in sqlQueryNoLog and IgnoreError means fewer things to go wrong and faster execution.  
Also, querying "without logging" while in the logging logic itself to prevent recursion is in reality a different operation than "querying without logging for performance reasons"

It looks like we can also add another layer of protection by recommending some additional PHP settings
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5081025/php-session-fixation-hijacking
In particular:
Set session.use_trans_sid = 0 in your php.ini file. This will tell PHP not to include the identifier in the URL, and not to read the URL for identifiers.

Set session.use_only_cookies = 1 in your php.ini file. This will tell PHP to never use URLs with session identifiers.

issue_comments.body: Ah, I thought Github was the primary now. I will pay better attention next time.

The problem only occurs when you're using the new CMS1500 (02/12) and an old claim.  OpenEMR now includes the code type with the diagnosis when justifying a code.  When the code type is included, it is stored in $code_data[0], and the actual code is stored in $code_data[1].  When the type is not included, the actual code is stored in $code_data[0].  When using the new CMS1500 (and therefore not stripping periods) OpenEMR would still look for the code in $code_data[1].

You'll also note that this throws off the diagnosis pointer.

Before Patch:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3718499/2731610/c2754c8c-c62f-11e3-9e14-764d1605ad66.png)

After Patch:

@bradymiller I added the styling back to the HTML file so that users would be able to modify it easily. The forcing of UTF-8 does nothing, as when the page is served over HTTP the `charset` attribute in the HTTP `Content-Type` response dictates what encoding to use. The UTF-8 encoding would only be forced when that page is saved and accessed locally.

what do this two .txt files contain?

Just a general PHP standards comment.  the == works most of the time.  Look up === for true 1-1 compares of both content and type.  Also use single quotes on fixed strings for better performance.  Double quotes have to be interpreted to see if they need expansion due to embedded variables or special characters.  And finally try and use the constant/key words 'true' and 'false' instead of numeric 1 and 0 for clarity.

$my_authorized = true;
There is probably a sexy way to do this with one function ...

A globals selector would be better if the intent is to make the options
part of the overall commit

issue_comments.body: Resubmitted as Pull Request #50

​
Brady,

I think that was the original intention, however it wasn't being
implemented near properly to do that, nor is it necessary for even PDO.
The implode was necessary to get the placeholders in the query originally,
my implementation removed an unnecessary for loop and removed the implode
for the placeholders. SQL expects a comma separated list of values for
"IN", which can be encapsulated in quotes; as so a single placeholder is
sufficient and more efficient. The previous attempt used two loops and two
implodes to generate that portion of the query, which adds a few
unnecessary opp codes with no added benefits; additionally an implode is
much more efficient than a loop by far. This code is already used in loops,
making it more complex than needed increases its CRAP score needlessly. If
I'd seen any merit in using multiple placeholders I would have fixed the
loop instead of removing it.

Thanks,

Sam Likins

WSI-Services
Owner / Creative Developer
Making Things Work
_727.490.WSIS (9747)_

issue_comments.body:
Thanks! I've tested the import with the most recent master version, so it should work for you as well.

When you test, perhaps you can import the US Edition if you have access to it? I think it should work, but as I haven't got the US Edition and it wouldn't be compatible with the Dutch Edition, I haven't tested it.

Hi Brady,

 
Great! The simple-refset file is/will be empty since this last release. The simple refsets that were there have been moved to extensions, because they really are an extension mechanism. The division between core content (concepts, descriptions and relations between them) and extensions (subsets, mappings to other code systems, etc) has become more distinct with the latest release.

When you import an extension, you should retain the same tables but with extra content - and the difference will be most noticeable in the simple-refset table.

 
The presentation you found gives a nice overview of the RF2 structure. If you are interested in learning more about SNOMED, I would recommend that you read (parts of) the IHTSDO Starter Guide. It contains an extensive introduction to the purpose and underlying principles of SNOMED, which explains why the system is so complicated and how it should be used.

 
The full specification of the RF2 tables is available in section 5 of the Technical Guide. That Guide is succinct and probably mystifying if it's your first exposure to SNOMED, but it does contain all relevant details. Both documents are available here: http://snomed.org/fileadmin/user_upload/doc/directory.html

 
Of course I'm also happy to answer any questions you have about SNOMED - in fact, it is my job to answer such questions ;-)

 
Cheers,

 

Feikje

You can do either \' or ''. But as I understand it '' is the SQL standard way of escaping a single quote.

The openemr_session_info table stuff is part of the authentication mechanism. It's a little hard to find because the way it's written it doesn't refer to it as "openemr_session_info". They break it up into two parts "openemr_" and "session_info". It's used in:
- interface/main/calendar/config.php
- interface/main/calendar/includes/pnUser.php

That insert looks like a carry over from when someone did sql dump and still had session data in that table.

If you can think about specific test case we'll be happy to replay it.
Are the changes in demographics screen compatible with other themes?

To be absolutely sure we can add FOR UPDATE . 

```
BEGIN TRANSACTION;
SELECT IFNULL(MAX(sequence_no),0) + 1 AS increment FROM ar_activity WHERE pid=1 AND encounter=1 FOR UPDATE
```

To my understanding , as long as the transaction is not finalized, MySQL will put all SELECT ... WHERE pid=1 AND encounter=1. ... FOR UPDATE queries on hold.

Also all queries with the same pid but with different encounter will be put on hold.

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-locking.html#innodb-shared-exclusive-locks
@bradymiller added the contrib/ tables.

Hi @bradymiller . we have tested @yehster 's solution and our solution under heavy load. We started to receive deadlocks errors.
We developed  a solution to emulate current functionality under load. The solution does include four sequence tables and ONDELETE triggers. We'll commit the changes today to you for comment.

The logging engine was the least of our problems!

And what exactly database engines do you have in mind? :)

Today we're already using MySQL-specific features like AUTO_INCREMENT and ENUM type all across the codebase. Porting these to different DB engine would require a lot of efforts and testing.

On the contrary, MSSQL, Oracle, DB/2, Postgresql - they all have triggers.
Even if a syntax differs, you can build triggers with equivalent functionality for different databases. 
We will need to maintain  different versions of database.sql for each database engine anyway :)

Triggers, stored procedures, UDFs - they are all our friends.

That said, we're open for suggestions :)
@yehster InnoDB migration project is something that all sides can benefit from.

The triggers are here: https://github.com/openemr/openemr/pull/124/files  .

@yehster @sunsetsystems What would you suggest to handle  the fields that are `TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT ''`?
@yehster how's the temporary table can hold its values between  restarts?

@yehster @sunsetsystems about the deadlocks. We have prepared a small script to test race condition.
The idea of the script was to run this `INSERT INTO ar_activity .... SELECT IFNULL(MAX(sequence_id))+1 AS sequence_no` via mysqli driver, repeat it with same values for pid and encounter 5000 times, and exit on mysql error. Then we run 4-5 instances simultaneously.
@sunsetsystems take a look: [http://pastebin.com/XLfmzG8w](http://pastebin.com/XLfmzG8w)

@sunsetsystems  is this SQL query what you proposed?

INSERT INTO `openemr`.`ar_activity`
  ( `pid`, `encounter`,
  `sequence_no`,
 `code_type`,`code`,`payer_type`,`post_time`,`post_user`,`session_id`,`modified_time`,`follow_up`,`follow_up_note`,`account_code` )

SELECT 1,1, 
    COALESCE( MAX(sequence_no), 0)+1 ,
    "type1","code1",1,now(),1,1,now(),'Y','',"acct1"
    FROM ar_activity WHERE pid=1 AND encounter=1 GROUP BY pid, encounter

Then try your query on an empty ar_activity table.

BTW using sleep gives the same results, just after a few more seconds.
Same error 1213... Just a few seconds later. Have you tried to run the query?
The script was a demo to simulate an unfortunate event. How would  you change the application's code?
And please try to run the query on an empty table.

@sunsetsystems Note you placed SQL code into an internal loop. With this loop, our SQL will work too, without problems and without the need of additional tables.

@bradymiller How do we continue from here?

Are we sure that $primary_docs['aun'][2] is properly escaped as a javascript-in-HTML string?  It must not contain the character ''' or the string "</script>".  The character can be escaped; the string has to be broken into two parts.

If a fee sheet item fails to have a _code_type_, this stops the loop and doesn't allow deleting it.

Properly done is:

``` php
foreach ($bill as $lino => $iter):
```

This exception doesn't cover **procedure_order**.

When deleting a patient hat has a procedure order in their chart, it tries to select from **form_procedure_order** which doesn't exist.

![procedure_order_failure](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2061925/176359/3d10be32-7b71-11e2-8e8a-5abacdd1179e.jpg)

Better instead to check for the existence of a table before attempting to select from it.

The table **form_physical_exam** uses **forms_id** as its id column. But here, **id** is hard-coded as the id column.

I have a more generalized solution for forms not following normal conventions here:
